column2: 5. Road signs that direct drivers to services are:
6. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column6: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.
column8: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column10: make a U-turn and return to the expressway.

column2: 7. Distractions that take your attention away from driving can be caused by ______ while driving.

column6: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 10. Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
column10: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.

column6: Watch for vehicles entering from the side

column4: The same as a steady yellow light.
column6: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.
column8: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.

column2: 13. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: the type of route you are on.
column6: how many miles are left before you reach your destination.
column8: that the route you are on might be dangerous.
column10: the speed limit on that route.

column4: The light will soon change to steady red.
column8: Go, but yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column10: The same as a STOP sign.

column4: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.
column8: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.

column4: there is a winding road ahead.
column6: there is a double curve ahead.
column8: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column10: there is a low place in the road.

column2: 17. When driving, it is important to keep a space cushion _______ of your vehicle.
column10: only on the left and right side

column4: Slow down, drive with caution and watch for children
column8: Watch out for children crossing the street

column2: 19. To keep your vehicle from rolling into traffic when parked on a hill, if you are facing uphill you should:
column4: turn the back wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.
column6: turn the front wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.
column8: set the parking brake and keep the front wheels straight.
column10: turn the front wheels away from the curb or edge of the road.

column2: 20. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
21. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.
column6: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.
column8: Come to a complete stop and use your horn to warn the vehicles behind you.
column10: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.

column2: 22. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column8: even if they are short sighted.

column4: they must stay on the right side of the divider
column6: there is a reduction of lanes ahead.
column8: there is a right turn ahead.

column2: 24. Your vehicles braking distance will be much longer:
column4: on wet, icy or gravel roads.
